chapter.para: This chapter provides on overview of the procedures required to set up, install and configure a Lustre file system.

note.para: If you are new to Lustre, you may find it helpful to refer to for a description of the Lustre architecture, file system components and terminology before proceeding with the installation procedure.

section.title: 4.1 Steps to Installing Lustre
section.para: To set up Lustre file system hardware and install and configure the Lustre software, refer the the chapters below in the order listed:

para.emphasis: Set up your Lustre file System hardware.

listitem.para: See - Provides guidelines for configuring hardware for a Lustre file system including storage, memory, and networking requirements.

para.emphasis: Configure storage on Lustre storage devices.

listitem.para: See - Provides instructions for setting up hardware RAID on Lustre storage devices.
See - Describes setting up network interface bonding to allow multiple network interfaces to be used in parallel to increase bandwidth or redundancy.
See - Describes preparation steps and a procedure for installing the Lustre software.

See - Describes how to configure LNET if the default configuration is not sufficient. By default, LNET will use the first TCP/IP interface it discovers on a system. LNET configuration is required if you are using Infiniband or multiple Ethernet interfaces.
See - Provides an example of a simple Lustre configuration procedure and points to tools for completing more complex configurations.
See - Describes how to configure Lustre failover using the Heartbeat cluster infrastructure daemon.
